chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Pheap K. Pom was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  May not own or oper. a MV w/out agent's consent.  No entry into taverns or liquor stores or where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges.  Forthwith, first 48 hours without Huber release.  However, Defendant is enrolled and may be released to participate in Drug Treatment Program (March 14) in Milwaukee.  Recommence jail after treatment completed.  Transfer to Dane County jail approved, per jail rules.  No jail credit during treatment release.
EMP, JAIP and ATIP all approved per jail rules.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pheap K. Pom in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Pheap K. Pom in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State gives status and sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Tsai agrees, however clarifies a few matters.  Attorney Tsai gives more background on defendant's pending issues.  Treatment date opens on March 14.  Requesting transfer to Dane County Jail and request ATIP, EMP programming.  Court goes through plea and priors.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  State gives final statement.  Attorney Tsai gives final statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
30 months Probation
DNA surcharge $250/sample  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
240 days Sauk County Jail, with Huber.  Forthwith, first 48 hours without Huber privileges.  However, Defendant enrolled in and to participate in Drug treatment program starting March 14 in Milwaukee.  Recommence after treatment program completed.  Transfer to Dane County Jail and with EMP, ATIP and JAIP.  No credit during treatment program.  
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety.  
May not own or oper vehicle without agent's permission.
No entry into taverns or liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Full time employment or schooling.
$1569.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
$25.00 Blood draw fee (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
36 month revocation & IID upon licensure.
Dismiss Count 2 & 3.  
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

Defendant Pheap K. Pom in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Pheap K. Pom in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives status.  Waiver today and proceed to argn.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Preliminary hearing at 02-26-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Pheap K. Pom in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Pheap K. Pom in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
noh

Defendant Pheap K. Pom appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State request $2500.00 cash bond. Time limits waived. $2500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances except with valid Rx.  May not oper a MV w/out a valid DL, take test if requested by law enf officers and may not enter any taverns or liquor stores.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
